intro: Anisora angulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anisora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Anisora angulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
